title: An Indecisive Client

en: You've landed a great freelance gig that's going to pay really well. There's just one caveat - the client can't make up their mind about what they want!
You've created a mockup that they initially accepted, but now they want to go with an idea they've presented. What should you do?

no_caption: Inform the customer that you're sticking with the original plan.

en: You grit your teeth and put in the extra work. The client thanks you, and you finally get paid.
The client is upset. Why hire you if you aren't willing to get the job done right? They pay you for your time, but you lose the gig.
